site.title: SysManage - Modern System Management Platform

hero.title: Modern System Management Made Simple
hero.subtitle: Centralized monitoring, management, and automation for your entire infrastructure. Support for Linux, Windows, macOS, FreeBSD, and OpenBSD.

welcome.title: Welcome to SysManage
welcome.description: SysManage is a comprehensive infrastructure monitoring and automation platform that helps you manage hosts, packages, and system health across your entire infrastructure. Whether you're managing a few servers or thousands of hosts, SysManage provides the tools you need to maintain and monitor your systems effectively.

secrets_management.title: Secrets Management with OpenBAO - SysManage
secrets_management.description: Enterprise-grade secrets management using OpenBAO vault for secure certificate deployment, SSH keys, and credentials management in SysManage.

header.title: üîí Enterprise Secrets Management with OpenBAO
header.subtitle: Revolutionary secrets management powered by OpenBAO vault - setting the gold standard for infrastructure security.

overview.title: üèÜ Second-to-None Security Architecture
overview.description: SysManage integrates with OpenBAO, the enterprise-grade secrets management platform, to deliver unparalleled security for your infrastructure. This isn't just another secrets manager - it's a complete security transformation that elevates your system management to enterprise standards.
overview.badge_description: OpenBAO provides bank-level encryption, zero-trust architecture, and enterprise audit trails that make SysManage the most secure system management platform available.

openbao.title: üöÄ What is OpenBAO?
openbao.description: OpenBAO is a cutting-edge, open-source secrets management platform that provides enterprise-grade security for sensitive data. Born from the HashiCorp Vault codebase, OpenBAO represents the future of secrets management with enhanced security, better performance, and true open-source governance.
openbao.benefit1_description: Every secret is encrypted at rest and in transit, with granular access controls and comprehensive audit logging.
openbao.benefit2_description: Lightning-fast secret retrieval and storage with minimal latency impact on your operations.
openbao.benefit3_description: Scales from single installations to massive multi-region deployments seamlessly.
openbao.benefit4_description: Generate short-lived, rotatable secrets that minimize exposure windows.

features.title: ‚≠ê Revolutionary Features in SysManage
features.certificates_description: Deploy SSL/TLS certificates across your entire infrastructure with zero downtime. OpenBAO securely stores certificates and private keys, while SysManage handles automated deployment to target hosts.
features.certificates_feature1: Secure certificate storage with encryption at rest
features.certificates_feature2: Automated deployment to multiple hosts simultaneously
features.certificates_feature3: Real-time deployment monitoring and status tracking
features.certificates_feature4: Comprehensive audit trail for all certificate operations
features.ssh_description: Revolutionize SSH access management with centralized key storage, automated deployment, and rotation capabilities that eliminate manual key distribution.
features.ssh_feature1: Centralized SSH key storage and management
features.ssh_feature2: Automated key deployment to authorized_keys files
features.ssh_feature3: Support for ed25519, RSA, and ECDSA key types
features.credentials_description: Store and manage sensitive credentials with military-grade encryption, making manual credential management a thing of the past.
features.credentials_feature1: AES-256 encryption for all stored secrets

architecture.title: üèóÔ∏è Security Architecture
architecture.description: The integration between SysManage and OpenBAO creates a fortress-like security architecture that protects your most sensitive data.
architecture.step1_description: Secrets are encrypted and stored in OpenBAO vault with metadata tracking
architecture.step2_description: SysManage authenticates with OpenBAO using secure token-based auth
architecture.step3_description: Secrets are retrieved on-demand with full audit logging
architecture.step4_description: Secrets transmitted to agents via encrypted WebSocket channels
architecture.principle1: Zero Trust: Every access request is authenticated and authorized
architecture.principle2: Encryption Everywhere: Data encrypted at rest, in transit, and in memory
architecture.principle3: Minimal Exposure: Secrets are only decrypted when needed
architecture.principle4: Comprehensive Auditing: Every operation is logged and traceable
architecture.principle5: Principle of Least Privilege: Access granted only as needed

deployment.title: üöÄ Deployment Workflow
deployment.cert_step1_description: Upload certificates through SysManage web interface, automatically stored in OpenBAO vault
deployment.cert_step2_description: Choose target hosts and deployment paths through intuitive web interface
deployment.cert_step3_description: Certificates securely transmitted via encrypted WebSocket connections to agents
deployment.cert_step4_description: Agents deploy certificates with proper permissions and verify successful installation
deployment.ssh_step1_description: Store SSH public keys in OpenBAO with metadata and access controls
deployment.ssh_step2_description: Assign keys to specific users and hosts with granular permissions
deployment.ssh_step3_description: Keys automatically added to authorized_keys files with proper formatting
deployment.ssh_step4_description: Verify SSH access works and maintain audit trail of all key operations

benefits.title: üèÜ Competitive Advantages
benefits.description: SysManage's OpenBAO integration delivers security capabilities that set it apart from every other system management platform:
benefits.enterprise_description: While other platforms treat security as an afterthought, SysManage builds on OpenBAO's enterprise-proven foundation from the ground up.
benefits.compliance_description: Meets SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA, and other regulatory requirements out of the box with comprehensive audit trails and encryption.
benefits.automation_description: Complete automation of certificate and SSH key deployment eliminates human error and reduces operational overhead.
benefits.integration_description: Native OpenBAO integration means no complex configurations or third-party dependencies - it just works.
benefits.monitoring_description: Monitor secret deployments in real-time with comprehensive logging and status tracking across all your infrastructure.
benefits.scalability_description: From single servers to massive multi-cloud deployments, the architecture scales without compromising security or performance.

getting_started.title: üöÄ Getting Started
getting_started.description: Ready to experience enterprise-grade secrets management? The integrated OpenBAO setup makes getting started effortless:
getting_started.step1_description: The sysmanage_secure_installation script automatically configures OpenBAO in production mode with secure defaults.
getting_started.step2_description: Use the web interface to securely upload certificates, SSH keys, and other sensitive data.
getting_started.step3_description: Select targets and deploy with real-time monitoring and comprehensive audit trails.

card.title: üîí Enterprise Secrets Management with OpenBAO
card.description: Revolutionary secrets management powered by OpenBAO vault - the crown jewel of SysManage's security architecture.
card.feature3: Centralized SSH key management and deployment
card.feature4: Zero-trust architecture with comprehensive audit trails
card.feature5: Military-grade encryption for all sensitive data

secure_installation.title: Secure Installation Guide - SysManage
secure_installation.description: Complete guide to the sysmanage_secure_installation script for automated OpenBAO setup and secure system initialization.

header.title: üîê SysManage Secure Installation
header.subtitle: Automated production-ready setup with integrated OpenBAO vault initialization and enterprise security defaults.

overview.title: üèÜ Production-Ready Security from Day One
overview.description: The sysmanage_secure_installation script represents a quantum leap in system management deployment. Inspired by MySQL's legendary secure installation process, this script transforms a basic SysManage installation into an enterprise-grade, production-ready security fortress.
overview.badge_description: What used to take hours of manual configuration now happens in minutes with bulletproof automation that never makes mistakes.

what_it_does.title: ‚ö° What the Script Accomplishes
what_it_does.description: This revolutionary script automates the complete transformation of your SysManage installation into an enterprise-grade security platform:

accomplishments.openbao_feature1: Automatic OpenBAO server configuration and startup
accomplishments.openbao_feature2: Production-mode vault initialization with secure defaults
accomplishments.openbao_feature3: Automated vault unsealing and secrets engine setup
accomplishments.database_feature2: UUID-based primary keys for enhanced security
accomplishments.admin_feature1: Secure admin user creation with Argon2 password hashing

cross_platform.title: üåê Cross-Platform Excellence
cross_platform.description: The secure installation script demonstrates SysManage's commitment to universal compatibility with intelligent platform detection and privilege management:

platforms.linux_description: Full support for all major distributions with automatic sudo detection
platforms.macos_description: Native macOS support with Homebrew integration
platforms.freebsd_description: BSD-native with doas and sudo support
platforms.openbsd_description: OpenBSD security-first approach with doas integration
platforms.windows_description: PowerShell and MSYS2 support with Administrator privilege detection

privileges.feature1: Automatic Detection: Detects current privilege level across all platforms
privileges.feature2: Smart Elevation: Uses appropriate elevation method (sudo, doas, or Administrator)
privileges.feature3: Virtual Environment: Maintains proper Python virtual environment context
privileges.feature4: Safety Checks: Validates environment before making system changes

usage.title: üöÄ Usage Guide
usage.prereq1: SysManage installation with virtual environment set up (make install-dev)
usage.prereq4: OpenBAO binary available (automatically installed with make install-dev)

flow.step1_description: Validates virtual environment, dependencies, and system requirements
flow.step2_description: Executes Alembic migrations to set up secure database schema
flow.step3_description: Creates administrative user with secure password hashing
flow.step4_description: Generates JWT secrets and applies security hardening
flow.step5_description: Configures and initializes OpenBAO vault in production mode
flow.success_description: Enterprise-grade SysManage installation ready for production use

security.argon2_description: Uses Argon2id, the winner of the Password Hashing Competition, providing military-grade protection against rainbow table and GPU-based attacks.
security.argon2_feature1: Memory-hard algorithm resistant to specialized hardware attacks
security.argon2_feature2: Configurable time and memory parameters for optimal security
security.argon2_feature3: Salt-based protection against rainbow table attacks
security.uuid_description: All primary keys use cryptographically secure UUIDs, eliminating enumeration attacks and providing enhanced privacy.
security.uuid_feature2: Prevents user enumeration and predictable resource URLs
security.jwt_description: Generates cryptographically secure JWT secrets using Python's secrets module for unbreakable token security.
security.openbao_description: Seamless OpenBAO integration provides enterprise-grade secrets management from the moment of installation.
security.openbao_feature3: Key-value secrets engine setup and configuration

troubleshooting.title: üîß Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.privileges_problem: Problem: Script fails with permission denied errors
troubleshooting.privileges_solution1: Ensure you have administrative privileges on your system
troubleshooting.privileges_solution2: On Linux/macOS: Use sudo or ensure your user is in sudoers
troubleshooting.privileges_solution4: On Windows: Run terminal as Administrator
troubleshooting.database_solution1: Verify PostgreSQL is running: systemctl status postgresql
troubleshooting.database_solution2: Check database credentials in configuration file
troubleshooting.database_solution3: Ensure database user has CREATE privileges
troubleshooting.database_solution4: Test connection manually: psql -h host -U user -d database
troubleshooting.openbao_problem: Problem: OpenBAO binary not found or initialization fails
troubleshooting.openbao_solution2: Manually install OpenBAO from official releases
troubleshooting.openbao_solution3: Check firewall settings for localhost connections
troubleshooting.openbao_solution4: Use --skip-vault flag to skip OpenBAO setup temporarily

post_installation.title: üéâ Post-Installation Steps
post_installation.description: After successful completion, your SysManage installation is production-ready with enterprise-grade security. Here's what to do next:
post_installation.check1: Secure Credentials: Store the generated .vault_credentials file in a secure location
post_installation.check2: Start Services: Use make start to launch all services
post_installation.check4: Login: Use the admin credentials you created during installation
post_installation.check5: Deploy Agents: Install and approve SysManage agents on your infrastructure
post_installation.check6: Upload Secrets: Begin using the secrets management features

card.title: üîê Secure Installation
card.description: Revolutionary automated setup script that transforms your SysManage installation into an enterprise-grade security fortress with OpenBAO integration.
card.feature1: Automated OpenBAO vault initialization in production mode

sles.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES)
sles.sles12_note: May require Software Collections (SCL) for newer Python
sles.firewall_note: SuSEfirewall2 or firewalld may block agent ports
sles.selinux_note: May require policy adjustments if enabled
sles.subscription_note: Some packages require active SLES subscription
sles.firewall_config: Open required ports via YaST or firewall-cmd
sles.apparmor_note: SUSE uses AppArmor instead of SELinux by default

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The SysManage server is a modern web application built with FastAPI (Python) backend and React (TypeScript) frontend. It provides a centralized platform for managing multiple systems through lightweight agents.
overview.backend_api: Backend API - FastAPI with async support, JWT authentication, and WebSocket communication
overview.frontend_ui: Frontend UI - React with TypeScript, Material-UI components, and real-time updates
overview.database: Database - PostgreSQL with Alembic migrations and comprehensive data models
overview.websocket_engine: WebSocket Engine - Real-time bidirectional communication with agents
overview.security_layer: Security Layer - Enterprise-grade security with mTLS, RBAC, and comprehensive scanning

header.title: Agent Documentation

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The SysManage agent is a lightweight, secure, cross-platform Python application that connects to the SysManage server via WebSocket for real-time system monitoring and management.
overview.auto_discovery: Auto-Discovery - Automatic server detection on the network
overview.secure_design: Secure by Design - mTLS, certificate-based authentication, no inbound ports
overview.package_management: Cross-platform Package Management - Native support for all major package managers

installation.title: üöÄ Installation
installation.description: Platform-specific installation instructions for all supported operating systems.

configuration.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration
configuration.description: Agent configuration options including auto-discovery and manual setup.

privileged.title: üîê Privileged Execution
privileged.description: Running agents with elevated privileges for package management and system administration.

cross_platform.title: üåç Cross-Platform Support
cross_platform.description: Platform-specific features, package managers, and system integration details.

troubleshooting.title: üîß Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues, debugging techniques, and solutions for agent problems.

security.title: üîí Security
security.description: Agent security features, mTLS configuration, and security best practices.

architecture.title: Agent Architecture
architecture.description: The agent operates as a persistent service with the following workflow:
architecture.auto_discovery: Auto-Discovery - Discovers SysManage servers on the network (if no configuration exists)
architecture.registration: Registration - Connects to server via secure WebSocket with authentication tokens
architecture.approval: Approval Process - Registers with system information and awaits administrator approval
architecture.mtls_setup: mTLS Setup - Retrieves client certificates after approval for enhanced security
architecture.monitoring: Monitoring - Monitors system health and sends periodic heartbeat messages
architecture.execution: Command Execution - Listens for and executes commands with validation and security controls
architecture.reporting: Reporting - Reports command results and system status with message integrity

server_installation.description: Complete installation guide for SysManage server including prerequisites, database setup, and configuration.

header.title: Server Installation Guide
header.subtitle: Complete step-by-step installation guide for setting up the SysManage server on your infrastructure.

python.title: üêç Python
python.note: Note: Python 3.13 is NOT yet supported due to package compatibility issues

postgresql.title: üêò PostgreSQL
postgresql.description: Primary database for all application data

os.title: üíª Operating System
os.platforms: Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD

ubuntu25.title: Ubuntu 25.04+ (Python 3.12 from Source)
ubuntu25.note: Ubuntu 25.04+ only ships with Python 3.13, which is not yet compatible. You must build Python 3.12 from source:

opensuse.title: openSUSE Leap/Tumbleweed
opensuse.note_leap: openSUSE Leap: Stable packages, Python 3.11 typically available
opensuse.note_tumbleweed: openSUSE Tumbleweed: Rolling release with latest packages
opensuse.note_nodejs: Node.js versions: May need to specify version (nodejs20) explicitly

sles.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES)
sles.note_sles12: SLES 12: May require Software Collections (SCL) for newer Python
sles.note_modules: Modules: Some packages require enabling additional modules via SUSEConnect
sles.note_firewall: Firewall: May use SuSEfirewall2 (older) or firewalld (newer)
sles.note_selinux: SELinux: May require policy adjustments if enabled
sles.note_subscription: Subscription: Active SLES subscription required for full package access

security_notes.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Notes
security_notes.never_production: NEVER use this password in production
security_notes.change_password: Change password in both PostgreSQL AND your configuration file

security_steps.title: üîê Required Security Steps
security_steps.never_commit: Never commit configuration files to version control

security_note.title: üîê REQUIRED for New Installations
security_note.description: The secure installation script must be run to create the initial admin user and configure unique security tokens for your installation.

features.title: What this script does:
features.admin_user: Creates the initial administrative user account
features.jwt_secret: Generates unique JWT secret for authentication
features.password_salt: Generates unique password salt for secure password hashing
features.config_hardening: Applies security hardening to configuration files
features.prevents_defaults: Prevents use of default/example security tokens

warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Security Notes
warning.required_desc: the application will not function securely without it
warning.unique_tokens: Each installation gets unique security tokens to prevent credential reuse
warning.run_once: Only run this script once per installation
warning.backup_config: Backup your configuration file after running this script

ssl.title: SSL Certificates (Optional)
ssl.description: For HTTPS development, place your SSL certificates in:
ssl.fallback: If certificates are not found, the system automatically falls back to HTTP on localhost.

db_issues.title: Database Connection Issues

db_issues.test_connection: Test connection with psql command shown above

port_conflicts.title: Port Conflicts

notes.title: üìù Notes
notes.host_binding: Host binding: Use 0.0.0.0 for external access, localhost for local only
notes.ssl_certificates: SSL certificates: If not provided, server falls back to HTTP
notes.port_selection: Port selection: Ensure the port is not in use by other services

security_warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Warning
security_warning.description: The example password abc123 is for development only. Always use strong passwords in production!

notes.title: üìù Password Policy Notes
notes.realtime_validation: Real-time validation: Policies are enforced in both frontend and backend
notes.multilanguage: Multi-language: Error messages available in all 14 supported languages
notes.flexible_requirements: Flexible requirements: Adjust policies to meet your organization's needs

providers.title: üìß Common SMTP Configurations
providers.gmail_note: Note: Requires 2FA and App Password. Visit Google App Passwords for setup.

mtls.title: mTLS Configuration
mtls.description: Mutual TLS settings are automatically managed by the server. When hosts are approved, client certificates are generated and stored in the certificate directory.

workflow.title: üîÑ mTLS Workflow
workflow.step1: Host Registration: Agent registers with pending status
workflow.step2: Manual Approval: Administrator approves host in web interface
workflow.step3: Certificate Generation: Server generates unique client certificate

service.title: üì° Discovery Service
service.description: Allows agents to automatically discover and configure themselves with available servers on the network.

security_checklist.title: üõ°Ô∏è Security Checklist

security_checklist.strong_passwords: ‚úÖ Strong passwords and secrets are used
security_checklist.db_credentials: ‚úÖ Database credentials are unique and strong

disaster.step5: Verification: Test restored systems and verify functionality

overview.description: SysManage employs a multi-layered testing approach to ensure reliability, security, and functionality across all components:

unit.description: Comprehensive unit testing for individual components and functions

coverage.value: 100% test coverage for both backend and frontend

msw.title: Mock Service Worker (MSW)
msw.description: API mocking for isolated and reliable frontend testing
msw.isolation: Complete test isolation from backend dependencies

frontend.title: Frontend Tests (TypeScript/Vitest with MSW)
frontend.description: Frontend tests automatically use Mock Service Worker for API mocking:

msw.title: MSW Behavior
msw.automatic: MSW automatically intercepts all API requests
msw.logging: Request logs appear in console output
msw.isolation: Each test runs in complete isolation
msw.realistic: Realistic API responses are provided automatically

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Mock Service Worker (MSW) is a powerful API mocking library that intercepts HTTP requests at the network level, providing realistic API responses for frontend testing. SysManage uses MSW extensively to ensure frontend components can be tested in isolation without requiring a running backend server.

benefits.title: Why MSW?
benefits.isolation: Test Isolation: Frontend tests run independently of backend availability
benefits.speed: Performance: No network latency, tests execute faster
benefits.reliability: Reliability: Consistent responses eliminate flaky tests
benefits.development: Development: Work on frontend features before backend APIs are ready
benefits.cicd: CI/CD: No need to spin up backend services in test environments

installation.title: Installation & Configuration
installation.description: MSW is already installed and configured in the SysManage frontend. The setup includes:

handlers.title: Request Handlers
handlers.description: MSW handlers are defined in /src/mocks/handlers.ts and provide comprehensive API coverage:

server.title: Test Server Setup
server.description: The MSW server is configured for Node.js test environments in /src/mocks/node.ts:

integration.title: Test Integration
integration.description: MSW is automatically configured for all tests in /src/setupTests.ts with proper lifecycle management:

dynamic.title: Dynamic Path Handling
dynamic.description: MSW uses broad pattern matching with dynamic path resolution:
dynamic.parsing: URL parsing extracts specific endpoint paths

realistic.title: Realistic Response Simulation
realistic.description: MSW provides comprehensive mock data that mirrors real API responses:
realistic.hosts: Complete host information with hardware details
realistic.packages: Software package data with search functionality

ci.title: CI/CD Integration
ci.description: MSW includes special handling for continuous integration environments:

automatic.title: Automatic API Mocking
automatic.description: Most tests automatically benefit from MSW without additional configuration:

custom.title: Custom Handler Overrides
custom.description: Tests can override specific handlers for custom scenarios:

compatibility.title: React 19 Compatibility
compatibility.description: SysManage includes special compatibility fixes for React 19 in the test environment:

bestpractices.title: Best Practices
bestpractices.isolation: Test Isolation: MSW automatically resets handlers between tests
bestpractices.realistic: Realistic Data: Use mock data that closely matches production API responses
bestpractices.coverage: API Coverage: Ensure all API endpoints used by components are mocked
bestpractices.errors: Error Scenarios: Test both success and error responses
bestpractices.logging: Request Logging: Use MSW logging to debug unexpected API calls

debugging.description: If tests fail due to API issues, check:

debugging.handlers: Handler patterns match actual API calls
debugging.setup: MSW server is properly started in test setup

database_security.title: Database Security - SysManage
database_security.description: Comprehensive database security documentation for SysManage including UUID-based primary keys, secure installation, and database hardening.

header.title: Database Security
header.subtitle: Advanced database security features including UUID-based primary keys, secure installation procedures, and database hardening techniques.

uuid_architecture.title: UUID-Based Primary Key Architecture
uuid_architecture.description: SysManage implements UUID-based primary keys across all database tables instead of traditional sequential integer IDs. This architectural decision provides significant security advantages and prevents common attack vectors.

enumeration.title: üõ°Ô∏è ID Enumeration Attack Prevention
enumeration.description: Sequential IDs (1, 2, 3...) allow attackers to easily enumerate resources. UUIDs eliminate this vulnerability by using non-predictable identifiers.

replay.title: üîÑ Replay Attack Protection
replay.description: Non-sequential identifiers prevent attackers from predicting valid resource IDs for replay attacks or automated scanning.

information_leakage.title: üîí Information Leakage Prevention
information_leakage.description: Sequential IDs can reveal business metrics (number of users, hosts, etc.). UUIDs prevent this information disclosure.

privacy.title: üïµÔ∏è Enhanced Privacy Protection
privacy.description: UUIDs provide non-correlatable identifiers that enhance user privacy and prevent cross-system tracking.

gdpr.title: üìã GDPR Compliance Support
gdpr.description: UUIDs support data anonymization requirements by providing identifiers that cannot be easily correlated across systems.

distributed.title: üåê Distributed System Security
distributed.description: UUIDs are globally unique, preventing ID conflicts in distributed systems and reducing attack surface in multi-tenant environments.

secure_installation.title: Secure Installation Script
secure_installation.description: SysManage includes a mandatory secure installation script that must be run on new installations to establish proper security foundations.

admin_user.title: üë§ Initial Admin User Creation
admin_user.no_defaults: Prevents use of default or example credentials

jwt_security.title: üîê JWT Security Token Generation
jwt_security.unique_secret: Generates cryptographically secure unique JWT secret
jwt_security.entropy: Uses high-entropy random data for token generation

password_salt.title: üßÇ Password Salt Generation
password_salt.unique_salt: Creates unique password salt for each installation

requirements.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Requirements
requirements.mandatory_desc: The script MUST be run before first use
requirements.backup_desc: Backup configuration file after script execution
requirements.no_defaults_desc: System will not function with default security tokens

database_schema.title: Database Schema Design
database_schema.description: All primary keys in SysManage use UUID version 4 (random) for maximum security:

validation.title: UUID Validation
validation.format: All UUID inputs are validated for proper format

authorization.title: Authorization Checks
authorization.resource_ownership: Resource ownership validated before UUID resolution
authorization.rbac: Role-based access control applied to UUID-referenced resources
authorization.no_enumeration: No information disclosure even for invalid UUIDs

maintenance.title: üîß Maintenance and Updates
maintenance.schema_review: Review schema changes for security implications
maintenance.performance: Monitor database performance and security metrics

migration.title: Migration from Sequential IDs
migration.description: SysManage has been fully migrated from sequential integer IDs to UUIDs using a comprehensive migration strategy.

step1.title: Step 1: Schema Migration
step1.description: Alembic migrations converted all primary keys and foreign keys from integers to UUIDs

step2.title: Step 2: Data Migration
step2.description: Existing data was migrated with new UUID identifiers while preserving relationships

step3.title: Step 3: API Updates
step3.description: All API endpoints updated to handle UUID parameters and responses

step4.title: Step 4: Frontend Updates
step4.description: Frontend components updated to work with UUID identifiers

benefits.title: Post-Migration Security Benefits
benefits.information_disclosure: Prevented information disclosure through predictable IDs

multi_os_cicd.intro: SysManage implements a revolutionary zero-cost multi-OS CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions, delivering enterprise-grade testing and deployment capabilities across Linux, macOS, and Windows platforms without infrastructure costs.
multi_os_cicd.benefit_1: Zero Infrastructure Costs: Complete CI/CD pipeline using GitHub's free runners
multi_os_cicd.benefit_2: Multi-Platform Excellence: Simultaneous testing across 3 major operating systems
multi_os_cicd.benefit_3: Fail-Fast Architecture: Immediate failure detection saves compute resources
multi_os_cicd.benefit_4: Enterprise Reliability: Production-grade testing with comprehensive validation

overview.title: CI/CD Pipeline Architecture
overview.description: SysManage's CI/CD pipeline represents a paradigm shift in cost-effective enterprise deployment, leveraging GitHub Actions' matrix strategy to deliver comprehensive multi-OS testing without dedicated infrastructure investment.
overview.backend_desc: Comprehensive Python test suite with pytest, database integration, and security validation
overview.frontend_desc: TypeScript/React testing with Vitest, Mock Service Worker, and component validation
overview.ui_desc: Cross-platform UI testing with Playwright and Selenium fallback for comprehensive browser coverage

github_actions.title: GitHub Actions Implementation
github_actions.description: SysManage leverages GitHub Actions matrix strategy to deliver enterprise-grade CI/CD capabilities with zero infrastructure costs, providing the reliability and scalability typically associated with expensive dedicated CI/CD platforms.
github_actions.triggers_desc: Pipeline executes automatically on code changes
github_actions.fail_fast: Fail-fast strategy stops execution on first failure

matrix_testing.title: Multi-OS Matrix Testing Strategy
matrix_testing.description: SysManage's matrix testing strategy delivers comprehensive cross-platform validation ensuring consistent behavior across all supported operating systems while maintaining zero infrastructure costs.
matrix_testing.comprehensive_desc: Every commit tested across all target platforms
matrix_testing.linux_testing: Linux: Ubuntu LTS with full dependency stack
matrix_testing.macos_testing: macOS: Native Apple Silicon execution environment
matrix_testing.bsd_simulation: BSD: Simulated testing via Docker containers
matrix_testing.ui_tests: UI Tests: User interface and workflow validation
matrix_testing.security_tests: Security Tests: Vulnerability scanning and compliance
matrix_testing.intelligent_desc: Smart test execution adapts to platform capabilities
matrix_testing.framework_selection: Optimal testing framework selection per platform

platform_specific.title: Platform-Specific Testing Features
platform_specific.description: SysManage implements platform-aware testing strategies that leverage unique capabilities of each operating system while maintaining consistent validation standards across all platforms.
platform_specific.linux_desc: Primary development and testing platform with comprehensive tooling
platform_specific.macos_desc: Native Apple Silicon testing with platform-specific features
platform_specific.windows_desc: Windows Server environment with PowerShell automation
platform_specific.cross_platform_desc: Ensuring consistent behavior across all platforms

best_practices.title: Enterprise CI/CD Best Practices
best_practices.description: SysManage's CI/CD pipeline implements industry-leading best practices delivering enterprise-grade reliability and efficiency typically found in costly commercial CI/CD platforms.
best_practices.cost_desc: Delivering premium CI/CD capabilities without infrastructure investment
best_practices.matrix_efficiency: Matrix strategy maximizes testing coverage per dollar
best_practices.intelligent_caching: Intelligent caching reduces execution time and costs
best_practices.security_desc: Enterprise-grade security integrated throughout the pipeline
best_practices.secret_management: Secure secret management with GitHub Secrets
best_practices.vulnerability_scanning: Automated vulnerability scanning in every build
best_practices.health_checks: Automated health checks and service validation
best_practices.retry_logic: Intelligent retry logic for transient failures
best_practices.enterprise_desc: Seamless integration with enterprise development workflows
best_practices.branch_protection: Branch protection rules enforce quality gates
best_practices.required_checks: Required status checks prevent broken deployments
best_practices.rollback_capability: Automated rollback capability for failed deployments
best_practices.value_desc: SysManage's CI/CD pipeline delivers measurable enterprise value through reduced deployment risks, faster time-to-market, improved code quality, and zero infrastructure overhead - typically saving organizations thousands of dollars in CI/CD platform costs while delivering superior reliability and performance.

performance_testing.page_title: Performance Testing with Artillery - SysManage Documentation
performance_testing.intro: SysManage implements a comprehensive performance testing framework using Artillery for backend API load testing, combined with Playwright for frontend performance monitoring. This enterprise-grade approach ensures optimal system performance across all deployment environments and scales.
performance_testing.benefit_1: Production-Ready Load Testing: Comprehensive API performance validation
performance_testing.benefit_2: Multi-Platform Testing: Validated across Linux, macOS, and Windows
performance_testing.benefit_3: Automated Regression Detection: Continuous performance monitoring in CI/CD
performance_testing.benefit_4: Enterprise Scalability: Performance budgets and SLA validation

overview.title: Performance Testing Architecture
overview.description: SysManage's performance testing framework provides dual-layer performance validation covering both backend API performance and frontend user experience metrics. This comprehensive approach ensures optimal performance across the entire application stack.
overview.backend_desc: Artillery-based load testing with realistic user scenarios, authentication flows, and API endpoint validation
overview.frontend_desc: Playwright-powered Core Web Vitals monitoring and user experience performance validation
overview.requirements_desc: Ensure SysManage server is running on localhost:8001 before executing performance tests. The testing framework validates against a live instance for realistic performance metrics.

artillery.title: Artillery Backend Load Testing
artillery.description: Artillery provides enterprise-grade load testing for SysManage's backend APIs, simulating realistic user loads and validating system performance under various traffic patterns.
artillery.health_desc: Continuous health endpoint validation (30% of traffic)
artillery.auth_desc: JWT authentication performance validation (40% of traffic)
artillery.api_desc: Core API endpoint performance testing (20% of traffic)
artillery.websocket_desc: Real-time communication performance validation (10% of traffic)
artillery.normal_desc: 30 seconds at 5 requests/second - Typical production load
artillery.peak_desc: 20 seconds at 10 requests/second - High traffic simulation

playwright.title: Playwright Frontend Performance Testing
playwright.description: Playwright provides comprehensive frontend performance monitoring focusing on Core Web Vitals and user experience metrics critical for enterprise applications.
playwright.fcp_desc: Measures when the first content element becomes visible
playwright.dcl_desc: Time for initial HTML document to load and parse
playwright.load_desc: Complete page loading including all resources
playwright.login_page_desc: Comprehensive page load performance and Core Web Vitals validation
playwright.login_flow_desc: Form interaction and authentication response time validation
playwright.network_desc: Resource loading optimization and network request monitoring
playwright.chromium_desc: Primary testing platform with full performance API support
playwright.firefox_desc: Cross-browser performance validation and compatibility testing
playwright.webkit_desc: Safari performance testing on macOS environments

ci.title: CI/CD Performance Integration
ci.description: SysManage's performance testing framework integrates seamlessly with GitHub Actions CI/CD pipelines, providing automated performance validation on every code change across multiple operating systems.
ci.trigger_desc: Performance tests execute on every push to main branch and pull request
ci.matrix_desc: Parallel testing across Ubuntu, macOS, and Windows environments
ci.validation_desc: Automated performance budget enforcement and regression detection
ci.reporting_desc: Performance metrics exported for trend analysis and monitoring
ci.baseline_desc: Historical performance data comparison with configurable tolerance bands
ci.alerts_desc: Immediate notification when performance budgets are exceeded
ci.trends_desc: Long-term performance trend monitoring and capacity planning

enterprise.title: Enterprise Performance Features
enterprise.description: SysManage's performance testing framework delivers enterprise-grade capabilities designed for mission-critical production environments, ensuring optimal performance at scale.
enterprise.load_concurrent: Concurrent user simulation up to 1000+ users
enterprise.cloud_desc: Comprehensive testing across AWS, Azure, GCP, and hybrid cloud environments
enterprise.onprem_desc: Dedicated testing for enterprise data center deployments
enterprise.hybrid_desc: Complex hybrid cloud and multi-cloud deployment validation
enterprise.dashboards_desc: Real-time performance KPIs and executive-level reporting for informed decision making
enterprise.capacity_desc: Predictive analytics for infrastructure scaling and resource optimization
enterprise.cost_desc: Performance-driven cost analysis and infrastructure efficiency recommendations
enterprise.compliance_analytics_desc: Automated compliance validation and audit trail generation for enterprise governance
enterprise.value_desc: SysManage's performance testing framework provides measurable ROI through reduced downtime, optimized infrastructure costs, improved user satisfaction, and enterprise-grade reliability that scales with your organization's growth.

ubuntu25.title: Ubuntu 25.04+ (Python 3.12 from Source)
ubuntu25.note_text: Ubuntu 25.04+ only ships with Python 3.13. You must build Python 3.12 from source:

step1.title: Python 3.9-3.12:
step1.check_path: Check "Add Python to PATH" during installation
step1.sqlite_included: SQLite3 is included with Python on Windows

step3.title: Git for Windows:
step3.description: Includes build tools needed for Python packages

openbsd.title: OpenBSD
openbsd.important_text: Rust is absolutely required for building cryptography packages. The agent uses certificate-based authentication which requires cryptography support for security.

netbsd.title: NetBSD
netbsd.important_text: Rust is absolutely required for building cryptography packages. The agent uses certificate-based authentication which requires cryptography support for security.

opensuse.title: openSUSE Leap/Tumbleweed
opensuse.leap_desc: Uses stable packages, may need manual Rust installation
opensuse.tumbleweed_desc: Rolling release, Rust available via zypper
opensuse.python_desc: Leap ships with Python 3.9+, Tumbleweed with latest stable

sles.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES)
sles.sles12_desc: May require Software Collections (SCL) for newer Python
sles.firewall_desc: SuSEfirewall2 or firewalld may block agent ports
sles.selinux_desc: May require policy adjustments if enabled
sles.subscription_desc: Some packages require active SLES subscription

openbsd_notes.title: OpenBSD-Specific Installation Notes
openbsd_notes.description: OpenBSD users require special attention to Rust installation:
openbsd_notes.security_note_text: The agent requires cryptography support for secure certificate-based authentication. Rust is mandatory for building these security packages. The run script automatically detects if Rust is available and uses appropriate installation methods.

auto_discovery.title: Auto-Discovery (Recommended)
auto_discovery.description: SysManage Agent includes automatic server discovery that eliminates manual configuration:
auto_discovery.step1_desc: If no configuration file exists, the agent automatically attempts to discover servers
auto_discovery.step2_desc: Sends UDP broadcast discovery requests and listens for server announcements
auto_discovery.step3_desc: Uses scoring system (SSL preference, local network preference)
auto_discovery.step4_desc: Writes complete configuration file and starts normal operation
auto_discovery.tcp_6443_desc: (or server port) - HTTPS connections to discovered server

manual.title: Manual Configuration (Alternative)
manual.generator_suffix: to generate customized agent configuration files for your environment.
manual.create_text: Or create configuration file manually at:

permissions.title: Required Directories and Permissions
permissions.dev_note_text: During development and testing, the application automatically detects test environments and uses temporary directories to avoid permission issues.

opensuse.firewall_desc: Open required ports via YaST or firewall-cmd
opensuse.selinux_desc: May require setsebool or custom policies
opensuse.apparmor_desc: SUSE uses AppArmor instead of SELinux by default

packages.title: Python Package Issues
packages.crypto_desc: Ensure Rust is installed and in PATH
packages.missing_desc: Install build tools and development libraries

discovery.title: Auto-Discovery Issues
discovery.ports: Ensure UDP ports 31337 and 31338 are accessible
discovery.firewall: Check firewall rules on both agent and server
discovery.service: Verify server discovery service is enabled
